createEnvName.label: Name of virtual env
createEnvName.name: createEnvName
createEnvName.help: Enter a unique name for your new environment. Use only letters, numbers, hyphens, or underscores. Spaces and special characters are not allowed.

pythonVersionDropdown.label: Python Version
pythonVersionDropdown.name: pythonVersionDropdown
pythonVersionDropdown.help: Choose a Python version to load from the available options. The selected version will automatically load the required GCCcore and Python module.

currentEnvDropdown.label: My environments
currentEnvDropdown.name: currentEnvDropdown
currentEnvDropdown.help: Choose from your currently existing environments.

mainscriptPicker.label: Main Python script
mainscriptPicker.name: mainscript
mainscriptPicker.help: Here you can specify the Python script you want to execute. You can either select it from a location on the cluster or upload it from your local machine.If you don't select a file here, you can still manually enter it in the preview window.

fileUploader.label: Upload files/data)
fileUploader.help: If your job uses any additional files, e.g.scripts, or input data, from  your local machine,  you can upload them here.

SlurmCheckbox.label: Set Job requirements
SlurmCheckbox.name: slurmbox
SlurmCheckbox.help: Check this box if you want to set Slurm Options.

tasks.label: #tasks
tasks.help: This is the number of tasks your code can utilize. This is mainly for codes that use MPI. If you are not sure, just leave this as 1
tasks.name: tasks

nodes.label: #nodes
nodes.help: Only set this field if you requested multiple tasks above and you want to distribute these tasks over multiple nodes. This is most common for MPI codes. If you are not sure, or if you don't want to explicitly distribute tasks over multiple nodes, leave this value at 0.
nodes.name: nodes

cpus.label: #CPUs/task
cpus.help: This option is mostly used for hybrid codes (typically codes that use both MPI and OpenMP). Only set this field if you are sure your code will utilze multiple threads per task. Keep in mind the total number of cores will be #tasks multiplied by #cpus_per_task).
cpus.name: cpus

gpuDropdown.label: Use Accelerator
gpuDropdown.help: Only select an accelerator if your job will utilize them. You might need to setup the environment for the accelerator you selected in the job script.
gpuDropdown.name: gpu

numgpus.label: #GPUs
numgpus.help: Number of accelerators you want to use. On ACES, in theory you can request up to 10.
numgpus.name: numgpu

memory.label: Memory
memory.help: OPTIONAL: provide the total amount of memory you esttimate the job needs. It's best to be conservative and request more. If your job will try to use more memory than requested, your job will be killed immediately and you might loose all intermediate results. If you don't enter any value, composer will use a default value.
memory.name: memory

Walltime.label: Expected run time
Walltime.help: OPTIONAL: provide the time you estimate the job will need. It's best to be conservative when requesting walltime. If your job exceeds the requested walltime, your job will be killed immediately and you might loose all intermediate results. If you don't enter a value, composer will use a default value of 2 hours
Walltime.name: walltime

account.label: Project Account
account.help: OPTIONAL: if you want to use a different project account than your default account, you can provide the account number here.
account.name: account

extraText.label: Additional Slurm parameters
extraText.help: OPTIONAL: You can specify Slurm-specific parameters here, e.g. --exclusive or --reservation=XXX. This is a specialized field to tailor your specific job requirements. Only use this option  if you are familiar with advanced Slurm flags.
extraText.name: extra_slurm
